Animal rights activists would gain more support and recognition, leading to increased funding and resources for animal welfare initiatives.
Animals would be protected from abuse and mistreatment, and laws would be enacted to prevent animal cruelty.
Animal welfare would become a higher priority in scientific research and experimentation, leading to more ethical and humane practices.
Animal agriculture would be heavily regulated or phased out, leading to a more sustainable and humane food system.
There would be a shift in societal attitudes towards animals, leading to greater empathy and respect for their well-being.
